description:
The first time that I ever came here was on a date (she recommended it). I don't date her anymore, but I still love to come here. I love this place and I love this part of town. 

The food is fantastic, the atmosphere is very relaxing and I love the view. Prices are reasonable. 

If there is a downside just remember that you are in the city in San Francisco so please make sure that absolutely nothing is visible on the seats or inside of your car. Parked car windows are frequently smashed and the contents of the vehicle emptied. The police are impotent - it's not that they are not capable or that they don't want to help, they can't help. The San Francisco DA will not prosecute anyone. So, just be careful.
author: J K.

description:
It's been years since I've visited the Cliff House so I was pretty surprised by the remodel! We were greeted right away by the hostess and brought to a table with the most incredible view. Clearly the renovation did not disrupt its beauty! So check and check to service and ambiance. 

Moving on, the food was as delicious as a I remember. We ordered the spicy calamari, crab cakes, chicken sandwich, cioppino and a few rounds of mimosas. Our server was super nice too, he wouldn't stop offering us mimosas.. wonder why lol. Anywho, my tummy was a happy, happy camper :) 

I docked a star because parking isn't the best. I'm sure parking farther on nicer days wouldn't be too bad given how scenic the beach is.. but it's a diff story when you're walking downhill in heels trying not to eat cement.

But 5 stars for customer service, ambiance and foodz!
author: ashley l.

description:
Loved the intimate brunch setting at the Cliff House.  Each reservation is for two hours. The selection of food was just right. I kept seeing the server replenish the dishes to keep them close to full. Unlimited mimosas. Seafood, salads, wonderful deserts. Just a really nice buffet brunch. 

The only complaint is parking in the area. You can find it but it might be a bit of a walk. Or you can Uber over.
author: Mitzi W.

description: Brunch was so good! The food was delicious and the staff was very friendly and attentive.
author: Nicole B.

description:
The Cliff House offers visitors a beautiful view of the ocean. It is very touristy and their prices reflect it. There was a wait list but you can pass the time strolling around the property or visiting the gift shop. 

My husband and I started with the Spicy Fried Calamari ($16.50) and the Steamed Clams. ($17.95) Both of these appetizers were fresh and served immediately. The sourdough bread taste wonderful soaked into the clam broth. 

For entrees we ordered The Cliff House Cioppino ($34.00) and Frutti De Mare. ($33.50) The Cioppono is a fish stew served in a tomato based broth. It was very garlicky and the crab was plentiful. The Frutti De Mare was the better of the two dishes. It is served with clams, shrimp, scallops, mussels and crab over a serving of linguini with a butter tomato sauce. The clams were over cooked and dried up in their shells but the sauce was especially good.
author: Laura G.

description:
I had been at Cliff House before in the bistro upstairs and wasn't THAT impressed. Very touristy, more geared towards an older crowd etc. So I wasn't too enthusiastic to come here for the champagne brunch when a friend invited me. I am not a big buffet fan. Just because I want to taste everything and hardly ever manage and then I'm sad :-/ But I must say, this one was a nice experience. (there were not TOO many dishes, which made it easier for me)

First off: the service was stellar. A big thanks to our waiter (darn, I forgot his name) who kept our champagne glasses filled at all times and who was funny and witty and just a delight. 
The ambiance wasn't too shabby either :-) 
We had a nice view over the water AND the buffet! 
And let's not forget the harp player. That was a really nice touch, she was amazing!

On to the food... it was good. It wasn't "oh my god I never had better food in my life" good, but it was good. Especially the desserts were amazing. I had a lot of shrimp and other kinds of seafood, the pastas were great. Can't say much about the breads (there was a good variety), because: NEVER FILL UP ON BREAD AT A BUFFET lol. 
Was it worth the $60 price tag per person? Hm. It probably was. We drank a lot of champagne! Would I come back? Yeah, but not if I had to pay for it myself.
author: Alexa W.

description:
My boyfriend surprised me with a Valentine's Day brunch here recently and we loved it. The only thing I wish was different was that I had a bigger stomach!

There are a lot of options for brunch, but my favorite was definitely the smoked salmon, kale salad, chilled shrimp, flank steak, miso salmon, scalloped potatoes, mac and cheese, and the cheese platter! I know that was a long list, but it sort of proves that everything was delicious! Of course we enjoyed the free-flowing champagne too. The waiters and waitresses never let my flute go empty.

Service was very friendly. This was probably the nicest brunch buffet i've been to. We'd probably only return for a special occasion though, because it is pretty pricey at $59 pp.
author: Tara A.

description: I'd suggest hiring security at least during hours of operation to prevent crime in the parking area (our friends' car's windows were shattered and a theft was committed - and as far as I know, the accident wasn't the first of a kind). Taking into consideration the overall quality and pricing of the restaurant, the management can definitely afford that to supply guests' comfort.
author: Anastasia B.

description: This is probably one of my favorite restaurants to take anyone who hasn't been before weather new to San Francisco, visiting or even locals who have not experienced it! Amazing spot to have brunch at or even better spot to grab a glass of wine at after Sutro Baths! Best view in San Francisco and I'm obsessed with sitting in the bar with the floor to ceiling windows! Cheese plate is amazing too :) recommended
author: Ellie J.

description:
Delicious food and friendly, attentive staff during Champagne Brunch.  Especially liked the veggies, salmon, flank steak, and the memorable butterscotch pots de creme served in an egg shell. 
Had an issue that waiter Ryan and manager handled well.  The tasty food and great service make me want to look for occasions to come back.

Parking can be difficult - be prepared to walk from uphill at the Land's End lot or down hill at Ocean Beach.  Worth it.
author: Lynn M.

description: I honestly thought the food taste was going to be like five stars, I got the crab omelet and it was OKAY nothing special. The potatoes needed more seasoning really plain.
author: Gaby C.

description:
Actually I am not sure is the one for brunch is same place as the buffet. But I just want to say it is soooooo good!

We walked in on a early Sunday morning. Not too much people at that time but it was full when we left.
We ordered a crab omelet, benidit, and the one I can't remember.
The food is so good and so match with the beautiful view there!
Super nice position!
author: Yantong Z.

description: Great view of the ocean and coast while enjoying a breakfast. The food is fresh and very tasty. Service is friendly and very attentive. Lunch is also good here with a lot of selections. Can be crowded at times due to the many tourist and visitors to the cliff house.
author: Andrew M.

description: You get a really nice view at the restaurant but their foods were very salty. I couldn't finish my steak and my fiancee also didn't finish her sea food plate. This place was highly recommended by tour site but I wouldn't go there again. You can do a little hike there though.
author: Paul L.

description: the view and the service were the best part of this place...food..Hmmm. on the plain side. cocktails? yes. we got so lucky today with an amazing sunset and a great table! thank you for the beautiful, elegant and sweet host.
author: Souris L.

description:
Went to a wedding here, last night...the view, incredible!
They had non stop service of refreshing adult beverages, horderves, Antree'were...Chicken, pasta n lamb.  My chicken was very moist w/lots of flavor.  Hubby had the lamb, he said it was good but the portion was small.
The desserts were absolutely scrumptious, I had the tiramisu cake...so moist w/full of flavor.
The venue alone, is worth the drive out there...the mot breathtaking view.
author: Barbara P.

description: We've been here like 4 times and this is our first time trying their brunch we celebrated our Fathers birthday july 15, 2018 here and we all have the great time ever with our dad the Food are really tasty, desert were superb, the view is spectacular! kids had sparkling cider in champagne glass and we adults had the best champagne  and treated with class oh oh dont get drunk now they love to fill up the champagne  promise worth the price, this is a brunch and my kids told me they had breakfast  lunch and dinner in 2.5 hours!! will be coming back for sure
author: MG B.

description: Food was absolutely perfect! Got the classic eggs Benedict, espresso ,calamari , potstickers and crab cakes which everything was cooked perfectly. The view was gorgeous. Parking was super easy due to us going on a Monday Morning at 10 am.
author: Adrieanna C.

description:
I've been at the Cliff House only three times, two times for the Sunday champagne brunch and one time just for drinks. 

This place is flawless. 

About the brunch: 
There's classical music playing, there's a woman playing the harp, there's bottomless champagne or apple cider and there's a delicious buffet. The food is really good and I love the desserts. 

You pay $60.00 per person and it's totally worth it. The location is amazing, the view is fantastic, the staff is super nice and they really care to make you have a great experience! I only wonder why I don't go more often... 
There are different turns to have brunch and you totally need a reservation. I would and will recommend this place and I'll take my friends/family there whenever I have the chance. I need more of this champagne brunches in my life. Seriously. 

I'd say you better come with Uber/Lyft and try to keep up with the servers pouring champagne.
author: Diana F.

description: We've had breakfast here many times and brought friends from all over the country there to not only share the food but the beautiful view while sitting and eating! We've seen migrating Whales, pods of dolphins and seals and events going on Ocean Beach below! Highly recommended
author: Robert J.

description: Perfection at its entirety! We just got back from Europe, to celebrate my mother's birthday here for brunch, and wow, the European dining experience is exactly what this felt like. Open buffet, with yummy food for brunch. Extremely impressed. The presentation, service and food, amazing.
author: Vadim F.

description: First time this past Sunday for brunch with my husband and my sister. Beautiful place with a breathtaking view! The brunch with champagne and coffee was excellent!! The food delicious!! You paid for what you get and so far this place in San Francisco is in our list as the best one!!
author: Fabiana P.

description: I recently had the pleasure to eat brunch here. The atmosphere with the music, the delicious food, the cleanliness and the great customer service from the workers was five stars fantastic. Highly recommend going to this place when you're in the Ocean Beach area!
author: Kangaroo K.

description:
Been watching the sunset here for 35 years, and still a magnificent view. Took a friend for the first time and we sat by the window. We lucked out as we were walk ins. 
Moderate wine selections attentive servers, fun music. Still a solid choice.
author: Korinda E.

description: Incredible view, many tasty options, and great service! The vegan (i think)  pumpkin ravioli was delish! I typically eat gluten-light so it didn't settle with me too well later on, but it was SO tasty and probably totally safe for people more gluten tolerant than myself. So grateful for a plant-based option at least. Home more are available in the future.
author: Amanda W.

description: Best of everything you can imagine, million dollar view of the Pacific Ocean while you enjoy the 5 star service of Sunday branch. From large prawns, seafood paella, popover with homemade jams, Korean bbq, fresh salmon and bubbly champagne. Come early to grab a nice cliff view seating, your reservation does not guarantee a window seat. Best place to start your glorious Sunday morning with someone playing classical harp music on a sunny day,
author: Dorothy Y.

description: My first experience at the Cliffhouse was interesting. I was on a date and completely overdressed for the occasion. I didn't realize there were 2 restaurants there and assumed I was going  to the fancier restaurant. At least we were seated by the window and had a GREAT view. After getting over all the stares, I enjoyed my meal to the fullest. Dress code is SF is generally pretty relaxed, but I think one side of the restaurant is more dressy than the other. Just make sure you know which one you'll be eating.
author: Ali R.

description:
The Cliff house has several different restaurant choices.  But by far the Sunday Buffet is the best bang for your buck.  Yes is is $60 per person...but worth every penny.  
The seating is crowded and most likely  you will enjoy a chat with those next to you.  The dress is casual.  But the service is TOP NOTCH.   The servers are so attentive and friendly.  
To start the champagne never stops flowing.  You may have to stop you server at some point.  If you are not into champagne... sparkling cider, coffee, tea and juice are all you can consume.   
The food runs from fresh fruit, salads, salmon, shrimp, eggs, breakfast meats, french toast, pancakes, bagels and loxs , to steak with mushrooms and scolloped potatoes.  Then there are desserts.  You could never get this much food in any other area of the Cliff house for that price.  
Okay my favorites.... The miso glazed salmon, roasted kale salad, scolloped potatoes,  roast beef and mushroom gravy, shrimp and shrimp.  The eggs Benedict are perfect.  
For dessert you must try the Butterscotch pot de creme in a egg shell.  You might need two.   
As well the servers keep your plates cleared at all times.  Always a clean plate and a full glass.   
This last visit was a "holiday" ... fathers day ... and they had a "carving station".  Bone in ham or new york steak carved to order.  It did cost extra on that day ($75 per person) ... still so worth it.  My hubby must have made 4 trips to the carved steak.    
Over all ... you can dress casual and be treated upscale.  Seatings are at 10 am -12 noon- 2 pm.  I would suggest the 12noon.  Arrive at least  20 mins early.  RESERVATIONS are a must.  But I had a reservation for 2, but the night before I wanted to bring along my niece and to be hubby...  when I called they said "no problem".  So glad we took them ... it was a blast.  Go Hungry... enjoy everything.   Oh I forgot about the "Harpist" playing.  A treat for eyes - ears - tongue.
It is a buffet ... but remember to TIP.  These folks work hard to keep you happy.
author: India G.

description: This was my first time at the cliff house ever. We went there for my god dad birthday and the location is good I love eating by water. Well the selection for the brunch was just ok not really $ 57.00 worth but hey it's fine dining. Services was top notch but food was slightly bland. I just feel like it was worth the money. But it was good to at least say I try it.
author: Elizabeth G.

description: Excellent brunch!  Our family is always searching for the next great brunch buffet.  We found it at the Cliff House.  The view is spectacular, perched on the cliffs above Seal Rock on the Pacific Ocean.  The options included seafood, salads, meats, vegetables, and desserts.  Some of the highlights included smoked salmon, kale salad with sriracha  cashews, interesting browned orzo, fresh salads,  warm and creamy scalloped potatoes, and lots of tiny yummy desserts.  Very very nice!
author: Charles L.

description: White table cloths. Exquisite service. Free flowing bubbly. Quality assortment of dishes. Fabulous ocean view. I like the idea that the buffet was not dominated with meats and just offered thin slices of teriyaki beef. Since this was a brunch buffet, fresh salmon, shrimp cocktail, eggs Benedict, and fresh green salads were done of the items that stood out. We started at 11:30am and left at 2pm. We were not rushed and were continuously offered more bubbly, coffee and water. This is my kind of place to spend time with my wife and friends.
author: Dan M.

description: Awesome breakfast place with great views. Dress warm if you are like me and don't like cold weather. Felt a bit chilly inside.
author: Nensi D.

description:
Pretty classy place to indulge in a bit of gluttony. There's a harpist for crying out loud - really enjoyed her rendition of Stairway to Heaven. The ambiance is very "Old San Francisco" and makes for some fun high-end eccentric people watching. 

The servers are delightful, and keep the free-flowing champagne replenished. Highlights of the buffet include eggs benedict, a huge tower of shrimp cocktail, miso glazed salmon and a lovely array of desserts. The butterscotch pot de creme was especially good. Oh, and on sunny days, the view of the ocean and Seal Rock is breathtaking.

Be sure to make a reservation. We had one for 12 noon and it still took 30 minutes to be seated.
author: Carole B.

description: Stunning views!!! But the food wasn't so stunning. Started with the lox which was superb. And since I was on a salmon kick I ordered it for the entree which dissapointed. This salmon was suppost to be wrapped in bacon. But the bacon was no where to be found. The sauce was bland, which was surprising since it was a mustard sauce. The presentation was beautiful but on accident. My fellow diners order the same and it was clear that part of my garnish had toppled off. It looked better toppled so I have to thank my server. All and all a good experience.
author: Allie P.

description: First time going here. Beautiful view and very fresh food. I had the Eggs San Francisco and the eggs were poached perfectly alongside with sweet Dungeness crab. I also had a mimosa which was very good. It is worth the price.
author: Jasmine R.

description: Historic spot right on the beach, great food and views!!! Come early for a good parking spot! Good portion sizes and knowledgeable staff of the food they are serving. Sooo much history on the walls, another must stop spot in the SF. Breath taking views!!
author: Varsenig K.

description:
Came here on a Saturday, super busy and out of beer.  On a Saturday/weekend? Really? 
Super busy, exept to wait for a while.
author: Raquel V.

description:
This review is for the Sunday Champagne Brunch Buffet in the downstairs Terrace Room.  Not a huge spread, but everything the 6 at our table tasted was delicious, not a mediocre filler dish to be had.  Well worth the $59/per person.  Favorites included the beef (tender!) with scalloped potatoes, mac & cheese (might have been there for the kiddies, but it was one of our favorites), lox, salmon, paella(!), several pasta dishes (tortellini, orzo, and more), shrimp cocktail, and faro with corn.  We appreciated the availability of vegetable dishes like cauliflower and mushrooms, asparagus, kale salad, shallots and garlic.  Of course, the fruit was plentiful and delicious, and the famous popovers were constantly replenished.  I've enjoyed the eggs benedict upstairs in the Bistro Cafe many, many times and was delighted to find they were delicious off the buffet table as well.  All this, with endless champagne, coffee, and tea made us a very happy group.  As another reviewer said, the emphasis on quality over quantity of dishes was much appreciated.  Many buffets, including the spectacular Sheraton Palace buffet of old had an endless array of dishes, but so many were just not worth consuming.  That was not the case with the Cliff House Brunch.  We enjoyed just about everything we tried.  My only regret is that in my 30 years in SF, I have not experienced this brunch sooner.  That will be rectified since I plan to come back. 

Although the dining room is not huge, the brunch table never seemed crowded, and we never felt we had to wait to get access to the buffet.  Our large table was a bit close to other large tables, so it was challenging at times to squeeze in or out of our seats.  Our server was very friendly, but I have to say service could have been better.  Having filled champagne glasses was not a problem, but plates were often not cleared, and we had to ask several times before water and coffee were refilled.  The lack of stellar service, however, did not take away from our enjoyment of a very good brunch.  Also, can I just say how easy this brunch is in terms of access by car and availability of parking as long as the driver does not mind walking a bit uphill?  There is a spacious passenger zone in front.  Also, unless you have a large party, reservations are not that difficult to obtain as long as you book a week or so in advance.
author: Susan C.

description: We often go to Cliff House so don't know what happened but it was my mother-in-law's 80th birthday and so we made reservations and went to Cliff House to celebrate. We went to dinner in the Terrace area (not the champagne brunch but they don't have section on Yelp for just the regular Terrace area) and before we were seated my husband informed the hostess (downstairs in front of the bar) that it was my mother-in-law's 80th birthday and so if perhaps a candle on dessert... and so she said "Yes, of course...thank you for telling us". So we thought it would be taken care of and assumed she told the waiter. Long story short...she did not tell the waiter...we sat through other people having happy birthday sung to them. We didn't expect the waiters to sing happy birthday...we would have done that but only a candle on the dessert. When it was time to order dessert we did and we are not dessert people. So...dessert came and no candle...and since we did not want to make a scene in front of my mother-in-law, we said Happy Birthday and finished our dessert. The point of the matter is: if the hostess would have said..."oh, I am sorry but we need a head's up in these matters" or "I am sorry, but we don't do that here" then we would have said "Okay then...then let's  eat dinner then one of us, runs to Safeway for a cake and candles to take home."  But she gave no indication that they would not or could not do a thing about the birthday or that they needed 24 hour notice or something. Very disappointed and my husband is still upset 3 days later because of course, you only get have one 80th b'day . I, of course, feel bad because going to the Cliff House was my suggestion. So, Cliff House, if you can't do anything for someone's b'day please inform the customer that you can't do anything about it so they could make other plans. Such a disappointment.
author: mallory g.

description: So it's pricey, but surely good views and a taste of San Francisco. I recommend crab cakes.
author: David A.

description:
Stunning views! Attentive service... we had Tiffany she was great! bacon crushed Scottish salmon was the best salmon I have ever had. I also had the Thai bouillabaisse which was also very good! 
We had the pistachio creme brûlée also on my top dessert ever tasted. Really love this place looking forward to going back in a couple weeks!
author: T V.

description: I lovely place a great establishing waiting staff where excellent food is fresh I just can't believe I've been passing this place up for the longest time and finally just to stop in and have a bite and I'm glad I did I got to give it four stars because it was pretty good
author: Paul P.

description: Only came here for coffee and our car got broken into... Apparently this place has a reputation for car burglaries and the valet guy said it happens all the time. A car comes by, knocks out the back window, and takes whatever they can quickly. Since no one will tell you especially not Cliff House, I would tell you to skip this place or at least keep all your valuables with you.
author: Ju L.

description: This place is exceptional. If you make the mistake of assuming that this location has mediocre food and is only good for a spectacular view of the North Pacific coast YOU ARE MISTAKEN!! The view was great but the food was extraordinary! I stopped for brunch and had the San Franciscan breakfast which was eggs Benedict over jumbo lump crab meat, resting on a perfectly toasted slice of sourdough bread. Fresh fruit and a basket of their delicious trademark popovers  accompanied the meal, along with a great cup of coffee and some really friendly servers. I will definitely return to try dinner next time I'm in the San Francisco area.
author: Esther S.

description: Delicious food, great service, and beautiful views of the Pacific ocean from pretty much anywhere in the restaurant. Hit this place up for a hearty brunch after a refreshing hike at Sutro Baths.
author: Evan F.

description:
I visited Cliffhouse recently with a friend and my service animal (a 20lb mini goldendoodle).  My service animal is extremely well trained / behaved.  I asked if I could possibly get some water for my service animal.  I was told by 3 different staff members, that my service animal could not drink water there because it was "illegal for service animals to eat or drink while they are working".  I told them that I was pretty familiar with all the service dog laws and I had never heard of this.  Their reply was that "it is probably different since it is located within a National Park".  I was pretty sure that a National Park would abide by the ADA (American Disabilities Act) which is federally mandated.  

Since my service dog is always working, I guess she would have to die of starvation and thirst?  This really makes no sense.  I later checked into this issue with someone who trains service dogs for a living, and I was told that I was given incorrect information.  Service dogs CAN drink water while working.  

I think management needs to educated themselves and their staff on service dog laws.

Although the views were breathtaking, my experience here wasn't great.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
I had the The San Francisco eggs and sangria. The complementary bread is so soft and delicious. The food that I order was great and the portion of crab that came with it was good and great tasting. The service is also really good and friendly (maybe even too friendly for SF). 

The sangria was ok. I personally wouldn't order it away. It was kind of flat.
author: Mariana V.

description:
The food was very good and the views were amazing.  If that's where it ended I would have given 4-5 stars but.....upon return to our car which was parked no more than 50 feet from the front entrance we had become a victim of the "smash and grab" auto burglaries epidemic that is plaguing San Francisco!  (Google it and read......it is out of hand!) Our windows were smashed and our belongings stolen.  We were one of four vehicles in a matter of 2 hours that were victimized!  This was at 11 am in the morning on a Monday.  In fact as I was calling into my insurance company, my buddy a Memphis policeman, noticed a suspicious vehicle "scoping out" other vehicles to victimized.  He ran and confronted the suspects and they sped off......the entire time a San Francisco cop sat there and did NOTHING......said he wasn't allowed.  Then he told me to submit a police report on line!  The Cliff House told us it wasn't their  problem and that it happens ALL THE TIME.  No security, cops saying they can't protect us against the bad guys, no support, no compassion.........NO MORE CLIFFHOUSE......or San Francisco for that matter.

Good food, great bloody Mary's, awesome views.......but dangerous/unsafe ...... And that's the opinion of the CLIFFHOUSE and the San Francisco cops!
author: Brian C.

description:
Quite pleased they got it right on the first try.
I can be a bit picky. I got the Joes scramble with double fruit and no potatoes.
author: Angel B.

description: We came here for brunch I and ordered San Francisco Egg Benedict and a coffee.  Coming from the Midwest, let me tell you: I haven't and an egg benedict that was cooked right for a VERY LOOOONG time. The crab meat was unearthly tender and mixed perfectly with the eggs. Our waiter was very polite and humorous. Such a good experience! Thank you!
author: Youzhu S.

description:
I only had drinks here and they were delicious! I had an Apple Cranberry Moscow Mule. It was light and refreshing. 
However, this review will probably be to get folks in here for the VIEWS. Located near Land's End, you can't not try to get in here on a chilly evening to catch the sunset. Floor to ceiling windows lets in ALL OF THE LIGHT for the best view of the Pacific and the sunset. 

Hopefully I'll be back again to try out the food!
author: Kahfii K.

description:
This is the utmost buffet experience I've had so far. Not that I had too many, but still. It's obviously on the expensive side, but hey, it's Cliff House afterall.

Food is fresh and tasty, there is a lady playing a harp (she even did "Stairway to Heaven"! How suitable for this heavenly experience!) and there are waves behind the window, which I all find supercool. Waiters are very attentive and they make sure your champagne glass is always fool. Oh, and don't even start me on the desserts!

My advice: take it easy. It's brunch afterall, so have some Eggs Benedict, bacon or scramble. Then proceed to some heavyweights, with brilliant roast and potatoes. Obviously don't forget some seafood along the way, this is why you've came here in the first place, right? Prawn salad is delicious, sample some salmon as well. And first and most of all, breathe in the atmosphere, the ocean, the classic surroundings.
author: Jakub S.

description: It's well it's not the best but it's definitely a go to if u new to San Fran with deep pockets cheers
author: Iz F.

description: This place came highly recommended by many locals for not only their breakfast but the views (if you're lucky enough to get a window seat... which we were).  I ordered the seafood omelet (scallops, crab and shrimp) and it was unbelievable... one of the best omelets I've ever had... the girlfriend ordered the French toast and she said it was absolutely delicious.  She is a Bloody Mary enthusiast, and the #1 ranked Bloody Mary since 2015 didn't disappoint... Reasonable pricing on our breakfast choices too.  Parking wasn't a problem, we went on a Friday morning in December, parking is on the street free of charge (surprisingly).  A lot of people say cars are broken into in the area, but there are a lot of people that frequent that are and I can't see how cars are being broken into without anyone doing anything about it... Bottom line, if you're visiting the are, this place should be on your list of breakfast spots to try before you leave.  I attached a view of our breakfast.
author: Chaz D.

description: Stopped in with bf for snack. Got a table by the window with a great view. Crab cakes are a bit small for price. Good fries and popovers.
author: Jennifer N.

description: We had a birthday bunch bash for my wife in March with  her closed friends. The weather was beautiful, the setting was unbelievable, the services are hands down, and we all had a blast. I found the menu has good variety of selection, food is well prepared and the price is very reasonable for this type of restaurant. A special shout out to our waiter Demitre who is very attentive, funny and helpful. We would definitely recommend to come here for any special occasions. The parking wasn't as bad as all the guests found spaces within reasonable distance from the restaurant.
author: Race C.

description: Very nice brunch and bottomless champagne. The smoked salmon was excellent as was the kale salad and fresh asparagus.
author: Miguel L.

description: The view is beautiful but there really wasn't anything special about the menu... besides using grilled cheese croutons in the tomato soup. Everything was standard
author: Ashley M.

description: The food and views are spectacular here. Our waiter was outstanding and the staff members seem to be as friendly as can be. Even the chef came and checked on us. The host (older Asian male) was the exception since he acted as if he was miserable and ready to retire. The food was amazing as well. The soup I believe was squash was a tad bland, but everything else - moscow mule, crab cakes, ravioli was certainly terrific and would order again. The ravioli was the best I have ever had. This is a place you must visit at least once in your lifetime.
author: Melly C.

description:
4.9.17 The service was awesome! The Chef checked on everyone and was so enthusiastic and that really rubs off onto the clientele. We were given the immediate right hand corner near the window which was perfect as we had a 2 year old and it gave us a little more space- or so it seemed. The shrimp cocktail was great, you have to have shrimp cocktail as it's not a party without it. I also enjoyed the shortbread cookies styled in a checkerboard pattern. I had 6. So.... The butterscotch pot de creme filled eggshells were neck in neck with the cookies. Those were thw highlight of dessert. Everyone at the table agreed. The chocolate mouse was fabulous, macarons were precious.

This is now officially our family birthday brunch tradition!

The gentlemen who was refilling our waters, champagne, coffee and martinellis was so attentive. He ran around that entire room with a smile on his face and was so professional. I really appreciated he and the Chef the most. They really added to the experience.

The shrimp salad was fabulous. I actually dreamt about it last night, which promted the review. The fresh shrimp with chrunchy celery and fresh dill! Ah- so delicious. The Au gratin potatos were as perfect as could be and the Tri Tip, oh my! Tender, melt in my mouth deliciousness.  

I know this review was all over the place, but you know how brunch is... Dessert first!
author: Stardust N.

description: The food looked enjoyable, since I went for the liquid breakfast (Bloody Mary) while my mom and cousin ate the real deal. They enjoyed the food.
author: Donald F.

description: Service is what makes it or breaks it for me and they are on point.. I really wanna give 4 stars just cause of no vegan options but I'm totally happy with fruit and avocado.. Dan out server was super attentive and friendly .
author: jessica b.

description:
My new favorite Sunday brunch place.
Excellent food, quality you taste, great service and beautiful views. 
I don't drink but for those who do you get bottomless mimosas, champagne. Coffee or tea. 
Vast selection of breakfast and lunch or even dinner items, from eggs Benedict to smoked salmon, to paella and wine beef, not to mention the wonderful variety of pastries. 
$59 per adult but is well worth it.
Parking can be difficult.
Reservations required 
Last seating is at 2 pm 
I ll be sure to take pictures ok my next visit.
author: Imelda G.

description: Excellent bar menu.  After enjoying a spectacular hike on the the Land's End Trail -- no better way to relax and enjoy the incredible views.
author: Nan M.

description: I just noticed that this place has a mediocre rating... so I need to set the record straight... I've eaten here a few times.. every time my food has been delicious, the service has been impeccable and  it is not overpriced! They have these amazing bread rolls they serve you that are like little bread soufflés. They are light, airy and warm when served. On every table they have this delicious strawberry jam and orange marmalade both are delicious. The views are amazing too... you cannot go wrong in anyway when you choose this place.
author: Darcy E.

description:
We had Mother's Day brunch here. We called the reservation line around Easter time so for this special Sunday brunch you have to call the day the phone line opens which they post on their website. Although pricey $70 a person (kids half price ) it was worth it for a special occasion. Many places in the city were charging around $50 for Mothers Day but for the view and the quality of food it was worth it. 
Highlights include fresh fruit perfectly cut, popover , French toast, roast beef, kale salad. They also had a harpist playing.

Only down side is they have to turn the table over every two hours so towards the end I did feel like we were getting the hint to move it along which with a bigger group you wish you had more time catching up.
author: Sam S.

description:
4 stars because of the beautiful view, good service and bottomless champagne. Otherwise would've been only 3 stars, and here's why. 

I've been to many Buffet Style Champagne Sunday Brunches, of all kinds, and for the $55 price tag (soon going up to $59), I expect a bit more than what was offered today. 

They had your typical Eggs Benedict (it was okay), some fresh fruit (underripe and pretty much tasteless), the cliche bow tie pasta salad, along with a couple of the other standard cold salad side dishes, but no Salad salad. 

They also had lochs and mini bagels (tasty), some sort of mediocre thinly sliced seared Asian beef dish (ok at best), and some prawns (which were good). Aside from the Eggs Benedict, the only other "breakfast" dishes they had were scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage and fingerling potatoes. There was a decent selection of desserts, the best of which that we tried was the scotch eggs (butterscotch pudding and whipped cream inside of a hollowed out eggs shell). 

So, that was pretty much it. I kind of wish they'd put the same focus and variety of choices in their brunch dishes as they did on dessert. Oh, and there was a harpist! Yes really, a lady was playing a harp, which actually was quite nice! Like I said, the view was absolutely gorgeous! It was a beautiful day today! The service was impeccable, and they certainly were not stingy on the champagne, which is why they got the 4 stars. 

There were some things missing for me, though. Where was the standing rib roast carving station? Where was the omelette station, or maybe even a waffle station? I also would've liked to have seen more options in the entrees and side dishes, like cheese blintzes (that I love and only get to have when I splurge on a Sunday brunch), or maybe steamed mussels, or oysters on the half shell, or ???....

I don't know, maybe I'm expecting too much. Maybe the $55 price tag was for the view. Like I said, the view was spectacular! But, I would've been happy to pay a bit more to get my slice of rib roast, or a tasty little omelette filled with ingredients of my liking.

Will I be back, you ask? Sure! I'll just show up next time expecting to being dazzled by the bottomless glass of champagne and the beautiful views, rather than the variety of food choices. 

Cheers!
author: D N.

description:
Best buffet I've had in the Bay Area, hands down! I was hesitant when I read many reviews saying there was a lack of variety, but I felt the variety was great--I couldn't even try everything I wanted to because I was so stuffed! This isn't your run of the mill buffet. Pasta with wasabi and caviar, seafood paella, butterscotch pot de creme, popovers, bagels and lox, and so much more. The tri-tip was my favorite and worth the extra price on New Year's Day. I can't wait to come back. I only wish I knew about this place sooner. 

Oh, and if it's your first time, wear comfortable shoes, you'll be tempted to explore the scenery before or after your meal for sure. It's a steep walk down toward the beach, and some very rocky areas. It can be windy, be careful while taking selfies from ocean cliffs!
author: Lizzie L.

description:
Had a wonderful experience tonight. It was my anniversary and wanted to take my boyfriend somewhere special. It was very special indeed. 
The view is spectacular though we had to wait a little bit to get a window table but everything starting from food and bill was worth it. 
So here is my rating for this restaurant:
Food- 9/10 (quantity) 
Service- 10/10
Price- 9/10 (It is on the expensive side) 
Overall-10/10
author: Nujhat Nashia R.

description: Another thing checked off our bucket list.  Brunch ok, but nothing we'd do again.  Pretty location, but not worth the $60 a head.  I'd much rather go to a normal really delicious breakfast than have so much just ok food.  Also, went to the 10:30 seating, it was pretty crowded, and with the sun out, got hot pretty quickly.  Service decent.  Coffee good.
author: Kate P.

description: One of the benefits of being the first in line for the 10am seating is our party of 6 got prime window seating!  And we had an awesome server named Chris.  We were celebrating a bunch of June and July birthdays all in one big shebang - and it was excellent!
author: David S.

description: Good food, drinks, and an amazing view!! If it's not foggy, and stay until sunset this is amazing and very romantic. The customer service was great too.
author: Stephanie D.

description: While it does offer stunning views, the brunch itself is just so-so.  Nothing out of the ordinary, when you factor in the cost.  Yes there was bubbly offered- but no omelet or carving stations...and everyone on line agreed the layout was inconsistent.  Why have smoked salmon and cream cheese out on table BEFORE bagels?  Everyone was having to reach over each other.  Service was fine.  You can walk up the cliffs and take photos without spending the $$$ at Cliff House-which I would not have minded, had it felt warranted.  Truly our only disappointing meal while in San Francisco.
author: Kathi B.

description:
I've been to Land's End quite a few times but this is the first that I've stopped and had brunch at Cliff House. I was there on a sunny day so with the light streaming in from the windows and being able to get a great view of the endless ocean, I had nothing to complain about in terms of ambiance. 

Our server was really friendly but was gone most of the time. Not too bad but do wish he would come by to check up on us once in a while. 

I heard that the popovers there are pretty good, it's like an empty cream puff. It was definitely soft and tasty. It's even better with butter and jam. Kinda wish there was a side of cream that came with it or coffee sauce....HAHA, now it's just wishful thinking. The popovers are bottomless and I've seen a few tables take some doggy bags home. The menu also mentioned something about selling the ingredients for you to make them at home. 

I really, really enjoyed the crab meat omelette (Johnson omelette?). It's pretty rare to find a place that can make a really fluffy and soft omelette like them. I know it seems simple but go out there and try it and you'll know what I mean. I dig the crab meat and avocado combo. I added some hot sauce to it and it was pretty legit. I could see a possible cajun spin to this but I don't think it'd fit with the restaurant's style...if anyone knows any other places for crab meat omelettes....let me know! HAHA. I would definitely come back just for this omelette, I'd like to try the shrimp and scallop omelette next time. 

The clam chowder was eh. The ingredients were definitely good and legit (clam and shrimp pieces) but it was overall just too thick for me. It wasn't overly salted like some other places though so I did appreciate that. The soup was so thick that I was full for most of the day after that. 

I really enjoyed my experience here and will definitely be back for more. If this place could up their coffee game, this would a hard place to pass up for good breakfast/brunch/lunch.
author: Kelly Y.

description: Was here on vacation. My friend wanted to take me to a place that had delicious food so she mentioned this place. We didn't even get to taste the food since we ended up leaving. They sat us down and we waited for 20 mins.....they didn't even serve us water. I'm all for letting waiters catch up but 20 mins and no water :/ especially at a fancy place, very disappointing. Not a great experience. Oh well I guess it wasn't meant to be, but the view was amazing.
author: Kayla G.

description: Great ambience. Enjoyed their bread with Jelly.. Definitely will visit this place again.
author: Ashok B.

description: Gorgeous view of the ocean and the staff were very nice! I came here with a group of friends visiting San Francisco from New York. We came here for brunch. This place was highly recommended. I ordered the Farmers Breakfast Scramble. The food was good, not the best, but had a healthy selection. The drinks were ok also. I honestly expected the price to be higher, although, it was still pricey. It had a vintage and very relaxing feel. Overall it was a nice experience and I'm glad we stopped by here.
author: Lisnel V.

description: The food was great , but the service not so much. The bartender was good , just not our waiter. We had to wait around for him a lot. Maybe checked on us once and another to get the check. The view is great, we wish we had gone during the day. If it wasn't for the poor service they would definitely get an 4 stars.
author: Paola A.

description: Sunday Champagne Brunch was quite good for the spread they had out!  Would have liked to have seen a few more unique entree's beyond the smoked salmon, salmon in white miso, and the teriyaki flank steak in addition to all of your regular brunch accompaniments.  The dessert table is to die for, especially the coconut macaroons and butterscotch creme de pots!  Service was great for pours of champagne and coffee...pretty much never had an empty glass until we put our napkins on top to say stop!  The views are amazing and we were able to be sat early at the noon sitting.  The ambience and the service during brunch as well as the fresh foods make this a hit!  The variety is a little lacking (as mentioned above), however you know you are paying for location and view when coming to a place like this.  Enjoy!
author: Steve Y.

description:
For a "Treat Yo-Self" day my wife and I went to the Cliff House for their Sunday Brunch.  Definitely pricey, more than I generally like to spend on a meal, but the food was outstanding.  We also absolutely adored our waiter, and he seemed to like us because he spent a fair amount of time at our table refilling our champagne and chatting (I hope your camping trip went well!).

The Buffet had lots of good options, and everything was excellent quality.  And of course the views are nice.  I'm only knocking off one star because of the price, but even that I'm hesitant to do because everything was so good.
author: Aaron D.

description:
Cliff House is easily the Sunday brunch that has the best ambiance and scenery, with a harpist gently strumming in the background, while you're overlooking the Seal Rocks and Pacific Ocean. Make sure you make a reservation for Terrace Room, not Sutro's or Bistro if you want the buffet brunch.

It's pricey ($55), but the buffet comes with all you can drink champagne, and they're generous with it. I would take a sip or two at a time, and someone would come by and top me off. Ridiculous!

The food is pretty standard for a brunch buffet, but everything is cooked as well as it can get on a buffet line, although I wish there were a little bit more options and a carving station, especially given the price. Service was fine, as mentioned with topping off champagne glasses.

I'm usually not one for dessert, especially during brunch, but everything looked so pretty. Butterscotch in an eggshell, chocolate mousse in a martini glass - you get the idea. I couldn't resist!

Brunch at the Cliff House Terrace Room is a neat experience - particularly if you feel like splurging.
author: Jerry C.

description: After 45 minutes of waiting and asking multiple times, we finally got our simple order of fries, which we had to take 'to go'. Rather than an apology, which would have been fine, we were asked if we wanted to cancel the order. I expect this at an Applebee's, not a nice restaurant. In short, come for the views, not the service.
author: Eloise Q.

description:
Ocean view is always a great site to sea... Lol get it?!? 
The food was ok.  The puffs are the highlight.  With our experience, which doesn't give much on the food.  Long wait depending on when you go.  Lots of tourists stop there.  

- Hiking trail near by
- great views on a beautiful day
- additional parking up the hill (north)
author: JennyandChi T.

description: Great food, great service, great view. I was excited to finally eat here after 5 years of living in SF. It did not disappoint! The view is great, even if you aren't right at the window, there's an airiness to the space and you can see the waves from many angles. The food was yummy and big helpings. I took my leftovers home and had a whole other meal the next day!
author: Kiley R.

description:
Just wish there was a made to order omelette station. That would've made this buffet five stars. 

We arrived there around 10 mins after our reservation, but we weren't seated until about 30 mins after our reservation. We also got seated at a table for six even though there were only three of us. However, no other parties were seated with us, so we still had our privacy -- which should be expected for how expensive this buffet was! 

The food here was definitely more about the quality, less about quantity. There was only one table of food, but everything was very well stocked. There were also some nice cold dishes like a kale salad and mixed beet salad. There was also a carving station with ham and beef. Around 3pm they took out the 

They should think about getting a different dessert chef, because nothing in the dessert department was that great. The chocolate on the chocolate covered strawberries didn't really have a strong taste of chocolate (maybe too diluted)? 

The harpist was also a really nice touch. Afterward, it's great to walk off all the food around the Sutro Baths and watch the sunset from the beach. The location couldn't be better.
author: Audrey L.

description: Honestly, I give it a 5 star rating because it has a spectacular view! Dinner overlooking the ocean is just priceless in my opinion or maybe I've lived in the desert for too long. Food and drinks were probably 3 stars, the view really makes the experience wonderful. I might have high expectations for food as I live in Las Vegas and our food here is just hard to beat. I believe I had a pork chop meal, it seemed a little salty but it wasn't horrible. The cocktails were definitely not my favorite.
author: Cindy F.

description: It's a very nice place with a beautiful beach view. But there is some defects. For example, the window tables are very limited, most likely you will just be sitting in the middle of a ballroom. Secondly, the food selection is limited too, and I didn't find something I really like in this Sunday brunch. They don't have much seafood, and the only meat you can get is the steak slides in my pic. But they do have a lot of desert.
author: Donald N.

description:
If there's one thing that I'm not a fan about SF is our brunch culture to...

Wait......
Wait...........
And.....................
Wait..................................

Sometimes for over 2 hours.

Damn, we must love watching paint dry on walls.

Don't get me wrong, I love catching up over brunch to get a recap of the weekend's drunken debauchery [that I no longer participate in] such as who hooked up with who and who face planted onto the bottle service table but I rather be doing it over text...in the comfort of my mumu in bed. 

If you don't mind paying a pretty penny for a mediocre brunch with a view then the Cliff House Terrace Room Champagne Brunch is the place for you as it's one of the very few places that accept reservations for brunch. NO ridiculous wait! 

It's a good place to bring out-of-towners but not foodies as the food was nothing remarkable. 

Street parking is terrible but there's a small parking lot up the hill to the right across from the diner, Louis'. We were able to easily find free parking here as most people tend to miss this small lot while driving through. 

~ * ~C O ST~ * ~ 
$49 pp includes unlimited bubbly. Our bill somehow ended up to be about $75 pp out the door for a party of 6. *shrugs* 

 ~ * ~S E A T I N G S~ * ~ 
10 am, 12 pm and 2 pm. 

~ * ~F O O D   S E L E C T I O N~ * ~ 
*2 STARS*
My friend visiting from SoCal compared the buffet selection to a mini cruise ship buffet aka it sucks. Sorry but it's true. 

For $49, I think most of our party expected more than 4 small tables formed into an "I" serving six salads, a fruit tray, eggs, bacon, sausage, french toast, smoked salmon, shrimp, skirt steak, eggs benedict, miso salmon, potato gratin, mac 'n cheese, paella, popovers, a dinky cheese tray, and desserts. This was 50% of the spread: http://bit.ly/190EBdh and only several things were actually good. It wasn't "quality" over "quantity" either.

I'm not a fan of throwing down money for brunch or buffets but I rather go to The Navio at Ritz Carlton for their brunch buffet that has 3x as many choices including luxury items like cavier, crab claws, fresh oysters, sushi station, and prime rib (my review: http://bit.ly/1chatMA). It wasn't the greatest but I like having choices and tons of them especially at a buffet. It's also much pricier at $120 pp out the door but $75 is already a lot to spend for brunch at the Cliff House so what's another $40-50? :X

 ~ * ~F O O D   Q U A L I T Y~ * ~ 
*3 STARS*
Unlimited bubbly served was Wycliff Brut. It retails at $5.99 a bottle but they probably get it for $3. I'm not much of a champagne drinker so this was just OK for me and I barely drank a bottle's worth. Besides, I don't think the older crowd here would have appreciated our drunken shenanigans. 

*Good: Eggs benedict, smoked salmon, and pot de creme
*Mediocre: Almost everything
*Bad: Congealed mac n' cheese, dry yet mushy paella, and Safeway like cakes and tarts

Everyone raves about the popovers but I didn't care for them. They were sitting in the steam tray and were dried out. For awesome popovers, Rotunda (Neiman Marcus) has the BEST!

~ * ~V A L U E~ * ~ 
*2 STARS*
You're purely paying for the view here. That's if you can see anything with the clouds. 

~ * ~S E R V I C E~ * ~ 
*5 STARS*
The staff is absolutely wonderful; very professional, polished, and attentive. Glasses of bubbly were constantly refilled without having to ask. Food on the steam trays were promptly replenished.

~ * ~V I E W~ * ~ 
*4 STARS*
Always nice to see a waterfront view but it was very foggy on the Sunday we went so we couldn't see much other than clouds.

~ * ~A M B I A N C E~ * ~ 
*3 STARS*
The space is a lot smaller than pictured and can accommodate up to 120 people. Décor is classy but very Golden Girlsish. They have a harpist playing which was cool. 

What IS up with having ONLY two restrooms (one stall each) shared among two restaurants (Terrace Room and Sutro) with hundreds of people?!? WHAT THE EFFF? Paying $75 then having to do the pee pee dance on the drive back home across the city. Not cool.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Give stars for Ryan, he is the ONE AND ONLY nice server here. Smiling and talking nicely to every table that he served. 
   Ok, so we visited from LA, Cliff house for brunch is our last stop then we will heading back. But the experience here was just so so. Food, bread is the best from all others! Service, I would like to say there is no service but Ryan! As I said , he is the only one serves friendly. Order the cheese burger and our server just throw it on the table without any word then left! She is way too coo! 
   Window seats have really nice views!
author: Joanna Z.

description:
We went here for the Sunday champagne brunch and were delighted!
The service was excellent and the food was even better. I had an eggs Benedict and popover which were perfect.
Next, I had fruit salad and a little paella.  The fruit was so fresh and sweet that I went back for more.
For dessert, I had a chocolate mousse which was topped with a large strawberry and whipped cream. I managed to have a couple of white chocolate chip cookies.
At $55 a person, it was an expensive brunch but we will return in a few years.
author: Philip C.

description:
The service once we were seated was excellent and the food was good as well! 

However..
We had a horrible experience checking in with the host for the other restaurant. We walked in and he looked/treated us like we were complete trash when checking in. He told us we did not have a reservation (which we did) and it took us about three tries asking him for him to finally tell us we had a reservation for the brunch room right next-door! We couldn't understand why he was being so purposely obtuse and not telling us he knew we had a different reservation. I've never felt so disrespected and it upset us for the first half of our brunch. 

Considering the price and the way we were treated, I don't know if I'd return:/
author: Aimee R.

description: We waited 30 min to get a drink, while sitting in the bar.  The older guy who is manager was very condescending and not rude to my mother. (On Mother's Day), when she inquired about seating.   First time there and it'll be my last.
author: Jeremy T.

description: Five stars because our expectations were exceeded. Nice fresh interesting dishes on the buffet. There is plenty of variety and it's not too traditional. We took a relaxing two hours, making for a special birthday celebration. The staff works hard, keeps smiling and comes around for juice, coffee and champagne or sparkling cider.  The buffet is immaculate, presentation is pretty. Fun variety of guests makes for good people watching too. We did the ten o'clock seating.
author: Stephanie M.

description: I must say I love every Champagne brunch so I might be a little bias in this situation. The cost is $55 a person including the unlimited champagne. They will continually poor the champagne but keep in mind the glasses are quite small. The food selection was great. Just to name a few; fresh fruit, orzo salad, assorted beets, shrimp cocktail, bagels and lox, kale salad, roasted cauliflower with mushrooms, French toast, assorted cheeses, brisket, scalloped potatoes, seafood paella, bacons, eggs, Mac and cheese, sausage, eggs Benedict and a a lot o dessert options. They have a lot more than just breakfast food so I think there is a little bit for everyone one. I also love that they give the kids apple cider in the same cups as the adult champagne. Super adorable
author: Eileen H.

description: Our family has the best time for my father in laws' 70th birthday. Great food, great view, and unlimited Champagne.
author: Tracy L.

description:
"More champagne?" 

"Why yes, please," I gleefully tell our attentive server at the Cliff House Terrace Room Champagne Brunch as he refills my third or fourth glass. 

At 55 dollars per person with bottomless champagne, I would consider the brunch here a steal compared to other places like the Ritz-Carlton at Half Moon Bay.  At both places, the draw is the amazing view.  Unfortunately, we were not seated at a table near a window, so that kinda took a way some of the fun for me.

The buffet is a little small and the desserts are forgettable - except for the butterscotch egg.  The fresh strawberries were surprisingly sweet.  

For my first round, I focused on breakfast.  The scrambled eggs were good.  I found the bacon a little too undercooked - I like mine crispier with most of the fat rendered out.  The french toast wasn't drenched in batter so it wasn't too soggy served with your typical fresh cut fruits like honeydew and grapefruit.

The lunch side included popovers or Yorkshire pudding and these were a highlight with  a great crust on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside.  I ate these with the assorted cheeses offered.  I didn't really like the cold pastas offered, but the Asian beef salad was good.  Gooey Mac n' cheese stuck to my bones.  

Like other reviews have mentioned, there's no carving station, and for the price, should have been expected. 

Parking can be a bit of a challenge, but after gorging myself it was nice to be able to take a nice walk along the shore.  To get to the cliff side of the building, head down one extra floor and that will take you to the most serene veiws of the coast.
author: Hieu H.

description: The BEST huevos rancheros I've ever had. Spectacular views and amazing service. Perfect place for a date for just brunch with friends.
author: Mindy A.

description: The view though. We had a great host that recommended the right things and it's certainly a top brunch spot. The food was nothing exceptional but with the overall atmosphere, it and for an amazing experience.
author: Michael H.

description: Made reservations here for a Sunday brunch with my girlfriends for our annual Secret Santa. We had a table for 7 by the window and tree - which was awesome! Service was amazing and there's lots to eat - fruits, eggs benedict, prime rib, bacon, desserts, and much more! A bit pricey, but I enjoyed the experience and atmosphere. Will return with my family the next time around :)
author: Amanda C.

description:
The cliff house... Perfect for a relaxed drink on a sunny eve. We got seats in the terrace room, not directly in front of the window but just one row back. The views of the sunset are exceptional.. Even from the second row. Enjoy the sunset against the backdrop of hills and sea and Chill out with a cocktail, French 75 is good.  

The staff were very friendly, maybe a little slow. 

Nibbles include seafood, chips and cheese plates.
author: Emer O.

description: If you want your car to get broken into and your stuff stolen, go here.  At least while they're stealing your stuff you have a great view and overpriced food.  Yelp protects these restaurants from these type of reviews by marking it as "Not Recommended" so don't be surprised if you see this review in that section.  This restaurant needs to hire security, the problem is they won't because the majority of patrons don't have their cars broken into.  They don't care about their patrons enough to shovel out the money to put a couple security guards on-site.
author: Easton K.

description: Great view and stop after your hike at Lands End! The clam chowder is delicious and the views are second to none.
author: Kati R.

description:
Gorgeous view of the ocean. Food was ok. There's 2 sides to the buffet but I was only able to get to one because there's no order to the way the line flowed. Seniors just stand there and take their time as if there isn't a bazillion peeps behind them. 

Service was great. They kept refilling our champagne, cider and water. Bloody Mary's are an additional charge.
author: Julie L.

description: We visited The Cliff House on October 23rd 2016 while on vacation in San Francisco.  First of all they have people crammed in like sardines.  We had to ask for another table because we could not get in and out of our chairs.  The buffet was mediocre at best.  Not what I would expect for $55 a person especially being right on the ocean.  Was looking for some seafood....  didn't happen !!  But the WORST thing is we have very strong reason to believe OUR WAITER STOLE OUR CREDIT CARD NUMBER !!!  IT'S THE ONLY PLACE WE USED THAT CARD !!  IT HAD TO BE HIM !!  HE CHARGED $607 ON MY CREDIT CARD !!!  HE DID IT ONLINE SO HE DIDN'T NEED THE CARD IN HAND....  JUST THE NUMBER !!!  This Place Has Thieves Working For Them !!!  STAY AWAY !!!!!
author: LaDonna P.

description: My two girl friends and I came here on a vacation, and heard from locals that the Cliff House was beautiful and a "must eat". Although the view of the beach from the restaurant was amazing, and the unique decor was really cool, the service was not up to par. The hosts at the front who were in their early twenties were not friendly, and they clearly knew we were first timers at this restaurant. They were not helpful and made us feel stupid that we did not know the style of seating arrangements or how to begin our ordering for the evening. No matter how gorgeous the location, the service and hospitality really makes all the difference. The food was great and makes a unique experience while in San Fran!
author: Daniel V.

description:
I would of given them a 4 but they screwed up big time. I was there for a wedding and was in charge of the reception table. Wedding days are stressful to begin with, all I asked for were 2 chairs for the reception table. I asked literally 5 times waited over 40 minutes for it and never received them before guests started to arriving! Girls in heels standing and stressing is no fun! We wouldn't of asked for chairs if we weren't wearing high painful heels. Chairs finally showed up in the middle of a heard of guests coming in and we were busy looking for their seats, too late!

Now on to the good, best bartender he was very attentive and hardworking. I saw him running around and helping everyone. Filet mignon was good bread was good we ate 3 baskets. Hors d'oeuvres were ok and service at the wedding was great.
author: Karen T.

description: I am contemplating whether to give this place a three or four stars. If compare to other brunch I've been to such as Scott's Seafood or Lordship, this cannot compare. The food selection were minimal and the quality of food were average. Customer service was excellent though compare to many place. The table seating is a bit tight and the ambiance was not what I expected for the charge of $55 per person. Overall, if you never been to brunch and want to stay in SF, then I do recommend Cliff house. However, if you don't mind crossing the bay, you must check out Scott's Seafood Brunch.
author: Denise M.

description:
My best friend wanted to treat me to brunch for my birthday and she asked me to choose where I wanted to go. I originally wanted to go to Foreign Cinema but since that was a no-go, she took me to the Cliff House Terrace Room for brunch. I must say, I was pleasantly surprised (or maybe that was the bottomless champagne talking? ;)). 

We had 12 p.m. reservations with window-seating and though we arrived on time, we didn't have a table with beautiful ocean views (-1 STAR). This ended up not being a problem because we were seated pretty close to all the food (don't judge me) AND there was bottomless champagne ;) who needs an ocean view when you have bottomless champagne? 

There was quite a variety of dishes, both for breakfast and lunch, while we were there and everything tasted amazing. Their brunch is served buffet style so you are able to try a little bit of everything. For my first round, I decided to try all the breakfast dishes. We both tried:
-the eggs benedict
-scrambled eggs
-french toast with cinnamon apple jam
-bacon
-sausage
-fresh fruit

I have to say that the scrambled eggs and french toast stood out. The eggs were fluffy and very fresh and the french toast was so delicious. I easily could have gone back for more of the french toast but I decided to try out their lunch dishes for my second round. 

For the second round, we tried:
-potatoes au gratin
-shrimp salad
-fresh shrimp
-corn salad
-tri-tip

My favorites were the shrimp salad and the tri-tip. While all the dishes were tasty, I have to say that breakfast was my favorite!

Even though I was full, I decided to stuff my face some more with dessert. I tried some of their fresh oatmeal raisin cookies and chocolate covered strawberries which were amazing. The cookies reminded me of homemade cookies - definitely weren't store bought. 

The service was great! Though we didn't get our original table, we ended up having such an amazing brunch and the staff was very attentive. We never worried about our water, coffee, and champagne refills. I also loved that there was a harpist - a really nice touch! This is definitely brunch for grown ups ;)

If you are a brunch lover, celebrating a special occasion, or hosting out of town guests, brunch at the Cliff House Terrace Room is a must!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
We were in SF this past weekend for our anniversary figured we take advantage & made reservations for brunch at the Cliff House...we gave each other that knowing look as we were seated in a banquet room at a table for 2 bumped up against another table (w/2 pp already seated) by the coffee station, throughout the meal we found humor in seeing other couples being seated in the room's standard seating arrangements with our same initial expressions on their faces. Fortunately for us we enjoyed the couple next to us.
The selection of food was modest (not extensive), desserts were yummy and wait staff was wonderful. Assuming the cost was for the ocean view on the other side of the room..
author: Laura M.

description: We knew that the food was not the draw of this place, but we had just completed a beautiful walk and wanted to have an early dinner.  The hostess seated us by the window, but that's where the good news ended!  The crab cake appetizers were mostly bread with a little crab, and honestly seemed like frozen food.  The salad was described as greens with goat cheese and crostini, and turned out to be limp greens with one crostini with a small dab of goat cheese on the tip!  The waitress didn't seem surprised with our protest, and brought us one more crostini.  The pot stickers, which we were reassured were home made, were too greasy to eat.  We fled at that point, grateful we were only $80 poorer.
author: Patricia H.

description:
Definitely an experience that is worth every penny! The layout of food and all of the different choices was just incredible. The waiter always made sure that our glasses were topped off and never had a dirty plate hanging out on he table for too long. 

I absolutely recommend this outing as a fun date brunch or a cool get together for the girls!
author: Hayley A.

description: Booked a reservation for a big party for mom's birthday. It was awesome! Better than expected. The food was fantastic. We were seated quickly, even as a party of 21. I can't wait to go back!!
author: Cr M.

description: Good was great! Service was amazing, bread to die for! Best place to take a date or friend out to lunch or dinner! We enjoyed it every minute of it!
author: Angel V.

description:
This was my first visit to the Cliff House for dinner in several years.  I had fond memories before this...   On the positive side, the views are spectacular, we could even see a pod of whales not far from shore.  The service was good, but the food was fairly average and overpriced, as others have mentioned.  Considering the prices, management should hire someone to keep the restrooms clean...the women's room looked like it hadn't been cleaned all day.  My husband had a similar comment about the men's room.  

After dinner, we returned to our car (parked about a 1/2 block away from the entrance) to find a window was smashed and several of our belongings stolen.  Our rental car (SUV) had out-of-state plates -- the police told us that was a magnet for thieves.  Out of curiosity, we drove back to the area the following evening, and noticed the same thing happened to another SUV with out-of-state plates, parked in nearly the same spot.   We spoke with a few people and learned these break-ins are typical. For what the Cliff House charges, perhaps they could afford to install a few security cameras??   We won't be back, that's for sure.
author: Deb F.

description: Very disappointed with my experience. I made reservations weeks in advance so naturally I thought we would have a table by the window. Instead it was an overflow table where my chair was in the hallway that goes to the bathroom and the waiter's station. It was miserable. The food is good though with the exception of the desserts. Standard cafeteria fare. Cake bites made with lard and factory made tarts. The champagne is sweet and inexpensive - I noticed most everyone ordered orange juice to cut the taste. There was also a huge busload of elderly ladies that took up most of the room and swarmed the buffet before the rest of us could get in line so everything was pretty much picked over. They replenished as fast as they could but I was so sad when I left - it was hard to leave a 15% tip - 18 or 20 was simply out of the question.
author: Yiv G.

description: Great food, ambiance and view at sutro - cliff house. Bar tender John was amazing, great drinks and a man truly of culture. Hands down best meal and dinner experience we had while in the Bay Area. We started with crab cakes and shrimp tempura which set the right tone. For entrees we went with Salmon and halibut which was cooked to perfection!! If and when we return to San Fran we will be back!!
author: David C.

description:
Beautiful location. Great views. 

Came for cocktails on Easter. Would definitely return if I went back to the Bay Area and needed a special occasion restaurant. 

The drinks were good. Service was great.
author: None O.

description: Absolutely divine Sunday brunch! Friendly and attentive wait staff, LARGE selection of delicious brunch and dessert items and beautiful views.  Perfect celebration for my anniversary. I will be back another time indeed.
author: Marion J.

description:
Everyone should treat themselves to this at least once. It is expensive but worth it.

I dined on a Sunday afternoon with my boyfriend for a belated Valentine's Day celebration. The view of the ocean is beautiful and romantic. The food is delicious. They served all the breakfast staples, plus paella, prime rib, and multiple salads and desserts. 

Afterward we walked along the Sutro baths and lands end. It was a wonderful afternoon. What an amazing location. Parking is challenging. That was the only downside. This is a San Francisco must.
author: Erin M.

description:
A bit overrated.  This place looks like it's trying to be more upscale than it really is.  
Considering it's a buffet, there isn't a large selection of items to choose from.  A bit disappointed at the amount of food options available, but what was served was good.  Most notable was the Paella and the French toast for me.  
$49 for buffet and unlimited champagne.  Too bad the champagne really isn't all that to rave about.
Parking is horrible during the day around the area so good luck finding a spot.
author: Karen L.

description: A beautiful setting overlooking the Pacific. Always a harpist and food choices that pleased everyone in my family. The food is fresh, salmon, lox, shrimp, eggs Benedict, pasta carbonara, grilled eggplant, French toast, bacon, and then chocolate deserts, pastries, oh and unlimited champagne, coffee, juice. We've always had friendly service and bring all of our out of town guests here. You won't be disappointed!
author: Jim D.

description: Delicious sparkling wine and tuna tartare. I recommend going downstairs to the bar area. Best view of the water from that location.
author: Mary K.

description: I think it's tacky management would let a family use a device with cartoons with volume on to babysit their child at the dinner table; the floor manager walked by grinning about it, if I wanted this atmosphere I could go to Chuck E Cheese. I came for what I thought is a getaway place; the stars are for the venue itself and decent staff -- though no one checked on me when I had to move to a service station area to get away from it.
author: J J.

description:
Ambiance was nice, we sat at the most perfect spot. Food tasted great, the choices were somewhat limited. Overall experience was great! 

Will visit again.
author: Toheed A.

description: Sunday Buffet cost $50 per head..you have to call and make a reservation..Unlimited Champagne included on the buffet which is very nice
author: Karl Stephen F.

description: Amazing view and the food was good. The service could have been better as we had to ask our request a couple times.
author: Dawn C.

description: It's always long wait list on weekend, We waited about 45 mins. And it was hard to find a parking place. During the wait time, we were hiking little bit outside the small mountain near the ocean! Nice place there! The ocean view was sooooo beautiful! We had relax conversation and enjoy our meal! The prices are okay! The plate is big and we were very full！I order the mushroom egg and beef.  For my taste, I think they cooked it with too much cheese and butter. Moreover, I like their services very much. Even though they were very busy but they always give big smile to guest. Good job! cliff house! By the way, I love their house special bread so much!
author: Bowie G.

description: Came here on vacation on my way to Napa. We were extremely excited as we drove up to the place and saw the incredible view. However, the view was probably about the best part of the experience. An indifferent and somewhat rude waitstaff paired with food that was just alright lead me to my 3 star rating. Make no mistake, you pay for the view here.
author: Currie C.

description: San Francisco ambience to the extreme! We went there for some dessert and the lemon soufflé was excellent. The chocolate lava cake was also good. Great service
author: FanOf 4.

description: The view was amazing!  Eating by the beach is truly fantastic.  There was a bit of a wait, and a someone confused shift change of the hosts, but eventually we got in.  We ordered the clam chowder and the cioppino.  Both were delicious and quite filling.  Even after a short hike at Lands end (the hike and the meal is a great combo for a date!).  Their popovers were so great!  So light and fluffy and yummy!
author: Joyce L.

description: My wife and I had dinner there last evening. Both of our dinners were excellent. The salmon was one of the best I've ever had. The view is spectacular. The only reason this restaurant didn't get a 5 star rating from us was our waiter. He was one of the most unfriendly waiters I've ever encountered.
author: Anthony F.

description:
The Cliff House was recommend by a friend.  I'm glad I took his advice.  As you enter the Cliff House, it is a bit confusing.  There are several restaurants.  Where do you go?  The champagne Brunch is on the bottom floor.  The hostess was very nice and friendly.

My +1 and I attended the 11:30 brunch.  I suggest you come early.  As we left around 12:45, the place was starting to fill up.  The room was bright and the sounds of a harp playing was nice.  The buffet  is centered in the middle of the room.  The tables are too close for comfort.  Community sitting is what I call it.  However, there is a good side to it.  Some of the conversations people are having are rather interesting.  Let see...I think the people I was sitting next to was possibly a shrink and friend/client.  I learned something from their conversation.  Never send an email when you are angry.  Got it!

My favorites of the buffet were the eggs, potatoes, salmon, peeled shrimp, pasta salad.  There is so much to eat.  All kinds of fruit.  Lots of desserts.  Bottomless champagne, apple cider, coffee and tea.  The staff is very friendly and attentive.   

As you exit the Cliff House make your way to the left down the stairs.  The view from there is stunning.  Take your photos.
author: Veronica V.
